Sequence Information.Function: PGLa and PGLa-H display a broad-spectrum of antibacterial activity against a range of Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. PGLa also displays antifungal activity against C.albicans ATCC 14053. PGLa-H shows moderate antibacterial activity against the multidrug-resistant methicillin-resistant S. aureus (MRSA) but exhibits very little hemolytic activity.

Literature.Title: A novel peptide designated PYLa and its precursor as predicted from cloned mRNA of Xenopus laevis skin.
Literature.Author: Kreil G.,Richter K.,Hoffmann W.

Literature.Title: The genes for the frog skin peptides GLa, xenopsin, levitide and caerulein contain a homologous export exon encoding a signal sequence and part of an amphiphilic peptide.
Literature.Author: Sures I.,Kreil G.,Kuchler K.

Literature.Title: Biosynthesis and degradation of peptides derived from Xenopus laevis prohormones.
Literature.Author: Williams D.H.,Gibson B.W.,Poulter L.,Giovannini M.G.

Literature.Title: Antimicrobial peptides in the stomach of Xenopus laevis.
Literature.Author: Turner K.,Tomassini N.,Brasseur M.M.,Bevins C.L.,Moore K.S.

Literature.Title: Isolation and characterisation of a new antimicrobial peptide from the skin of Xenopus laevis.
